document.docAuthor: Stebnicka, Z. Teresa & Skelley, Paul E.
document.docTitle: Haroldiataenius semipilosus Stebnicka & Skelley 2009, comb. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Haroldiataenius Chalumeau (Scarabaeidae: Aphodiinae: Eupariini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genus Haroldiataenius Chalumeau (Scarabaeidae: Aphodiinae: Eupariini)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ataenius semipilosus Van Dyke 1928: 158
–
Cartwright 1974: 34-36
;
Dellacasa 1988: 197
(catalogue).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Clypeal margin rounded to weakly angulate each side of middle; surface finely punctate and weakly wrinkled. Pronotal coarse punctures evenly distributed, separated by 1-2 diameters, larger laterally, becoming small at medial anterior margin; basal marginal line distinct, width equal to coarse punctures. Elytral intervals evenly convex. Lateral margin of pronotum and elytron with fringe of short setae.
Haroldiataenius semipilosus
is found in the southwestern USA ( Arizona , Texas ) and northern Mexico .

Type data .
Holotype (not examined), “ Texas Pass, Dragon [Dragoon] Mountains, Arizona ”, “Van Dyke Coll”, in CASC .

Remark. Most specimens of
H. semipilosus
have been collected at light, but a few were collected in
Neotoma
nests.
Haroldiataenius semipilosus
appears most similar to the partially sympatric
H. lucanus
(see remarks under
H. lucanus
). However,
H. semipilosus
differs by its smoothly convex elytral intervals with scattered long setae and the incomplete posterior marginal line on the meso- and metafemora.
